summary: This document is a July 2, 2020 letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office to Judge Katharine H. Parker requesting the unsealing of Indictment 20 Cr. 330 against Ghislaine Maxwell, along with the resulting unsealing order. It formally initiates the public criminal case against Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the defendant in Indictment 20 Cr. 330, which the government is requesting to unseal.

persons.name: Katharine H. Parker
persons.context: The judge to whom the government's request to unseal the indictment is addressed, and who signs the unsealing order.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York who submits the request to unseal the indictment and is listed on the order.

persons.name: Alex Rossmiller
persons.context: Assistant U.S. Attorney listed on the unsealing order application.

connections.description: Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is the lead prosecutor bringing the criminal case (Indictment 20 Cr. 330) against defendant Maxwell.
Judge Parker is the judicial officer presiding over the initial request to unseal the indictment against Maxwell.

events.title: Government Requests Unsealing of Maxwell Indictment
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office files a request with the court to unseal Indictment 20 Cr. 330 against Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Court Orders Indictment Unsealed
events.description: Magistrate Judge Katharine H. Parker signs an order granting the government's request, unsealing the indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
500 Pearl Street, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: On July 2, 2020, the U.S. Attorney's Office formally moved to unseal a criminal indictment (20 Cr. 330) against Ghislaine Maxwell.

The indictment charges Ghislaine Maxwell with violations of U.S. criminal codes including 18 U.S.C. §§ 2422, 2423(a), 1623, 371, & 2, which relate to crimes such as enticing minors to travel for illegal sexual activity, conspiracy, and perjury.
Acting U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss and AUSA Alex Rossmiller are the prosecutors on the case.
Magistrate Judge Katharine H. Parker granted the request and ordered the indictment unsealed on the same day it was requested.
The case is designated as a 'Wheel C' case, indicating it is a criminal case assigned via a wheel system in the Southern District of New York.
